## MultidimensionalPlot class

Class that creates a multidimensional composition plot (2,3,4,5,6,7,8-dimensional) in 3D

The position of the samples is affected as follows: - 2-d: Line - 3-d: Triangle - 4-d: Tetrahedron - 5,6,7,8-d: Predefined tabulated positions

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
declare class MultidimensionalPlot 
```

|  [setCamera(camera, resetCamera, watchModified)](./composition-plot.multidimensionalplot.setcamera.md) |  | Set a specific vtkCamera object to be used<!-- -->This is useful if there are multiple composition plots that need to have their camera sychronized |
|  [setColorMap(map, range)](./composition-plot.multidimensionalplot.setcolormap.md) |  | Set the colormap used to color samples based on a figure of merit |
|  [setCompositionSpace(compositionSpace)](./composition-plot.multidimensionalplot.setcompositionspace.md) |  | Set the composition space of this plot<!-- -->The composition space is the list of elements that a sample can be expected to have in its composition |
|  [setCompositionToPosition(compositionToPosition)](./composition-plot.multidimensionalplot.setcompositiontoposition.md) |  | Change the way samples are mapped to the 3D space based on their composition |
|  [setInverted(inverted)](./composition-plot.multidimensionalplot.setinverted.md) |  | Invert the direction of the colormap |
|  [setRadiusFn(radiusFn)](./composition-plot.multidimensionalplot.setradiusfn.md) |  | Set the function that determines the radius of each sample |
|  [updateSizesArray()](./composition-plot.multidimensionalplot.updatesizesarray.md) |  | Rerender after the sample radius function has been modified |
